member.name: T:Reimers.Google.Map.Static.StaticMap
member.summary: Renders a Google Static Map on a web page.

remarks.para: The rendered map is an image fetched from Google's Static Maps API.

example.para: The code below shows how to define a StaticMap using markup alone.
example.code: <%@ Page Language="C#" AutoEventWireup="true" CodeFile="Default.aspx.cs" Inherits="_Default" %> <%@ Register Assembly="Map" Namespace="Reimers.Map.Static" TagPrefix="Reimers" %> <%@ Register Assembly="Map" Namespace="Reimers.Map" TagPrefix="Reimers" %> <%@ Register Assembly="Map" Namespace="Reimers.Map.Controls" TagPrefix="Reimers" %> <%@ Register Assembly="Map" Namespace="Reimers.Map.CustomMaps" TagPrefix="Reimers" %> <%@ Register Assembly="Map" Namespace="Reimers.Map.Geocoding" TagPrefix="Reimers" %>

The following is a list of valid format values:
CReturns the position as a comma separated string (lat,lng)
DReturns the position as Degrees Minutes Seconds. Ex: 51°N 30´ 00´´ 0°E 0´ 0´´
JReturns the position as a JavaScript command.
MReturns the position as a MicroFormat compatible HTML formatted sting.
UReturn the position as a URL compatible string. Values are separated by a forward slash. Ex 51.500000/0.000000

member.name: T:Reimers.Google.Map.Map
member.summary: Renders a Map on an ASP.NET 3.5 or 4 page.

example.para: To render the map on the page register the assembly using the following markup.
example.code: <%@ register assembly="Map" namespace="Reimers.Map" tagprefix="Reimers" %>
example.para: Use the following markup to insert the map on the location of the page where you want it:
example.code: <Reimers:Map ID="Map1" runat="server" />
example.para: Further attributes can be set in the markup. Note however that properties set in the markup cannot be changed during postbacks or callbacks.
The code below shows how a Map can be defined using markup alone.
example.code: <%@ Page Language="C#" AutoEventWireup="true" CodeFile="Default.aspx.cs" Inherits="_Default" %> <%@ Register Assembly="Reimers.Google.Map" Namespace="Reimers.Google.Map" TagPrefix="Reimers" %> <%@ Register TagPrefix="Reimers" Namespace="Reimers.Google.Map.Maps" Assembly="Reimers.Google.Map" %>

member.name: E:Reimers.Google.Map.Map.MapLoaded
member.summary: Triggered when the map is finished loading

remarks.para: Some map tiles map still be loading when the event triggers.

The event is triggered as a result of a asynchronous callback to the server. While this allows for event handling using serverside code, all changes to the page (either the map or other controls on the page) must be done using JavaScript commands passed to the MapCommand of the event arguments parameter.

example.para: The following code is an example of how the overlays collection can be filled with markers within the bounds of the map when it loads. The code loops through a and checks whether the coordinates held in the table are within the bounds of the map. If so they are added to the map's overlay collection and a command to render them is generated.

member.name: M:Reimers.Google.Map.Marker.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

example.para: The code below shows how to read marker information from a database and create the appropriate markers.
example.code:
Dim conn As New SqlConnection("Your connection string") Dim cmd As New SqlCommand("SELECT ID, Lat, Lng, Text FROM Overlays", conn)
conn.Open()
Dim dtr As SqlDataReader = cmd.ExecuteReader While dtr.Read Dim marker As New Marker marker.theID = dtr("ID").ToString marker.Latitude = CType(dtr("Lat"), Double) marker.Longitude = CType(dtr("Lng"), Double) marker.MarkerText = dtr("Text").ToString Map.Overlays.Add(marker) End While
dtr.Close()
conn.Close()

member.name: M:Reimers.Google.Map.Marker.#ctor(System.Guid,Reimers.Core.Maps.ICoordinates)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. Creates a new instance of a Marker
member.param: The location of the Marker as a .

remarks.para: Creating a marker using this creates a static marker with the minimum information needed. Further data and functionallity can be added after the marker is created.

example.para: The following example shows how to create a marker in a click event handler to place a marker on the clicked location and persist the state of the control.

example.para: The code below shows how to read marker information from a database and create the appropriate markers.
example.code:
Dim conn As New SqlConnection("Your connection string") Dim cmd As New SqlCommand("SELECT ID, Lat, Lng, Text FROM Overlays", conn)
conn.Open()
Dim dtr As SqlDataReader = cmd.ExecuteReader While dtr.Read Dim marker As New Marker marker.theID = dtr("ID").ToString marker.Latitude = CType(dtr("Lat"), Double) marker.Longitude = CType(dtr("Lng"), Double) marker.MarkerText = dtr("Text").ToString Map.Overlays.Add(marker) End While
dtr.Close()
conn.Close()

member.name: M:Reimers.Google.Map.Polyline.ParsePointString(System.String)
member.summary: Parses a string of coordinates to create a List of LatLngs.

remarks.para: The expected string format is dd.ddd,dd.ddd dd.ddd,dd.ddd dd.ddd,dd.ddd - a sequence of comma separated coordinates using dot (.) as a required decimal separator. Negative number use a minue (-) prefix.
The expected order is lat/lng.

If is set to true then the expected order is lat/lng, otherwise lng/lat.

member.summary: Gets or sets a JavaScript function to be executed on the client when the mouse moves inside the map pane.

remarks.para: The code that executes in this handler can use the passed variable 'latlng' (case sensitive) to obtain the current location of the mouse pointer as a GLatLng object.

example.para: To fill a textbox with the coordinates use the following code:
example.code: document.getElementById('theClientsideIDofTheTextbox').value = 'Lat: ' + latlng.lat() + ', Lng: ' + latlng.lng();
example.para: To fill a div element with the coordinates use the following code:
example.code: document.getElementById('theClientsideIDofTheDiv').innerHTML = 'Lat: ' + latlng.lat() + ', Lng: ' + latlng.lng();
